title: Benidorm star Julie Graham, 54, marries her toyboy beau Davy Croket, 38
text:
Benidorm actress Julie Graham has tied the knot with her skydiving instructor beau, four years after her first husband committed suicide.

The star married Belgian Davy Croket, 38, in Brighton on Friday after meeting while she was filming the hit ITV show, reports the Sun.

Helping them celebrate their special day was actor Tony Maudsley, 51, who played Kenneth DuBeke in the comedy series, and even caught the bouquet.

Newlyweds: Benidorm actress Julie Graham, 54, married skydiving instructor Davy Croket, 38, in Brighton on Friday, four years after her first husband Joseph Bennett died

Julie looked sensational in black dress which was covered in a delicate white floral pattern.

The star, who has also appeared in The Bill and Doc Martin, tied her dark locks back in a high pony tail and accessorised with a white flower clip.

Groom Davy looked dapper in a dark blue velvet blazer, jeans and brown brogue shoes.

Former flame: Julie's former husband, Joseph Bennett, committed suicide on April 13, 2015. The actor was found hanged in Richmond Park, 70 miles away from their Brighton Home

Big day: Davy and Julie, pictured exchanging rings on their wedding day, met while she was filming Benidorm and he was working in the Spanish resort

The pair have been together since 2016 and Davy lives with Julie at her home along with her daughters Edie May and Betty.

Speaking to the Sun on Sunday in 2016 Julie was full of praise for Davy, saying: 'He’s just lovely, gorgeous and he makes me happy.'

She added: 'Meeting somebody was the last thing I wanted to do. I was adamant that I wanted to spend some time on my own.

Happy times: Actor Tony Maudsley, 51, pictured with Davy, who played Kenneth DuBeke in the ITV comedy series, caught the bouquet co-star Julie's wedding in Brighton

'Although the year was very difficult in some ways, it has been really positive too.'

Julie's husband of 13 years, Joseph Bennett, committed suicide on April 13, 2015.

The Howards End actor was found hanged in Richmond Park, 70 miles away from their Brighton Home.

Actress: Julie played matriarch Sheron Dawson in Benidorm, pictured, and has also starred in Doc Martin, The Bletchley Circle and The Bill

The 44-year-old was known for his role in The Bill, and met Julie when they worked together on a play in 2001.

Julie and Joseph, who had two children, met in 2001 while starring as brother and sister in a stage play.

They married the following year in a secret ceremony in Brighton in front of just two witnesses and honeymooned in Venice.

Times on set: Julie, pictured wearing a swimsuit and sarong, and Tony, pictured centre in green, worked on the show which aired from 2007 until May last year

In an interview at the time Julie gushed: 'People had proposed to me before but I had always hesitated.

'But after eight months, he asked me to marry him and I said 'yes' immediately.

'I'm absolutely nuts about him. I've never felt like this about anyone before. This is the happiest I have ever been.'

For confidential support call the Samaritans on 116123 or visit a local Samaritans branch, see www.samaritans.org for details.
description: Julie Graham, 54, married Davy Croket, 38, in Brighton on Friday. The Benidorm and Doc Martin star's husband of 13 years Joseph Bennett died in 2015.
